analyzed: de bzung bas a'ag ma gzung bar bya'o zhes pas kri gnyis brjod do //

analyzed: aa bhy'a sa'i bya ba'o //

analyzed: yon tan med pa zhes pa ci zhe na /

analyzed: ka ro mi /

analyzed: ru dha sogs kyi bi ka ra na'i mtha' dbyi'o //
translated: The qualityless of the vikaraṇa ending in rudha, etc. is elided.

analyzed: bi ka ra na de'i mtha' dbyi ba ni bi ka ra na'i mtha'i dbyi ba'o //

analyzed: byings thams cad pa la dbyi'o zhes pa 'jug ste /

analyzed: dza h'a ti'i sapta m'i la dbyi'o zhes pa 'di las gong du'o //

analyzed: yon tan med pa zhes pa 'jug ste bh'u'i mtha' zhes pa 'di las gong du'o //
translated: The qualityless is applied. The ending in bhu is from this above.

analyzed: rudha sogs kyi bi ka ra na'i mtha'i yon tan med pa byings thams cad pa pha rol la dbyi bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dhut rnams kyi bzhi pa rnams la gsum pa'o zhes pas da nyid do //

analyzed: tstshi di bhi di dag gi sgra med pa rnams la shit ma yin pa zhes pas ta'o //
translated: Cchidi and bhid are without sound. Therefore, it is ta, not shita.

analyzed: tstshinda dhi / bhinda dhi / tshi dir\ bhi dir dag la hi'o //

analyzed: snga ma bzhin du na sgra'i mtha' dbyi'o //

analyzed: mtha' smos pa ni bi ka ra na'i mtha' dbyi ba ldog pa'i don du'o //

translated: The statement the letter A of the two and all implies that the first consonant should be explained as having the nature of A. Thus, this is the accomplishment of the first vowel.

original: gsal byed gcig pa'i dbus na yod pa'i dang po ma bsgyur ba'i aa'i pa ro& ksha la'o //
analyzed: gsal byed gcig pa'i dbus na yod pa'i dang po ma bsgyur ba'i aa'i pa ro& ksha la'o //
translated: The first one in the middle of a single consonant is the first one that is not changed, the a of aṃ, and the kṣa.

original: gcig kyang de yin la gsal byed kyang de yin pa ni gsal byed gcig pu'o //
analyzed: gcig kyang de yin la gsal byed kyang de yin pa ni gsal byed gcig pu'o //

analyzed: gsal byed gcig pa dang gsal byed gcig pa ni gsal byed gcig pa ste /

original: gzugs mthun pa las gcig lhag ste rnam dbye gcig pa la'o zhes pas gsal byed gcig pa'i sgra ni mthun pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs mthun pa las gcig lhag ste rnam dbye gcig pa la'o zhes pas gsal byed gcig pa'i sgra ni mthun pa brjod pa'o //

analyzed: de'i phyir gsal byed gcig pa gnyis kyi dbus na yod pa zhes tshig rnam bar sbyar ro //

original: byings gang gi dang po bsgyur ba de ni dang po bsgyur ba'o //

original: des na byings dang 'brel pa can gyi gsal byed gcig pa dag ste /
analyzed: des na byings dang 'brel pa can gyi gsal byed gcig pa dag ste /

original: dang po bsgyur ba med pa de ni /

analyzed: bru las ngag dang por a'ita'o zhes pas yon tan can la a'ita'o //

original: 'dir yang gang gi tshe byings thams cad pa ma yin pa la rnam par bshad pa de'i tshe brunya dbyangs mtha'i nyid las ya'i rkyen byas pa na /
analyzed: 'dir yang gang gi tshe byings thams cad pa ma yin pa la rnam par bshad pa de'i tshe brunya dbyangs mtha'i nyid las ya'i rkyen byas pa na /
translated: Here also, when it is not a general verbal root, then when the vowel ya is made the condition of the final vowel ya of bru,🔽it is changed to ba by the rule “ba-tsam-zha.”

original: brtsi ru bsgyur bas ba tsam zhes pas 'gyur ba dang / dngos po'i yul la rnam par bshad bzhin pa la ni brtsi ru bsgyur ba dang po byas pa la gsal byed kyi mtha' nyid las ghyan byas par gyur pa na b'atsyam\ zhes pa grub bo //
analyzed: brtsi ru bsgyur bas ba tsam zhes pas 'gyur ba dang / dngos po'i yul la rnam par bshad bzhin pa la ni brtsi ru bsgyur ba dang po byas pa la gsal byed kyi mtha' nyid las ghyan byas par gyur pa na b'atsyam\ zhes pa grub bo //
translated: When the object of the rule is a general verbal root, then after the first change to ba is made, when the final vowel ya is made the condition of ghya, then ba-tsam-zha is accomplished.🔽cakṣuṅ-khayāṇo

original: tsakshinga'i khy'inya'o // tsakshinga'i byings thams cad pa ma yin pa'i yul la khy'anya ra bsgyur ro //
analyzed: tsakshinga'i khy'inya'o // tsakshinga'i byings thams cad pa ma yin pa'i yul la khy'anya ra bsgyur ro //

analyzed: byings thams cad pa ma yin pa zhes pa ci zhe na /

analyzed: brtsegs pa'i dang po sa ka dag gi mtha' la yang zhes pas ka dbyi'o //

analyzed: gang gi tshe byings thams cad pa ma yin pa pha rol la zhes 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: When it is not all the verbal roots, but rather to the other, then🔽the meaning of the word is the function of both the word and the affix,

analyzed: tsakshinga'i ru tsa sogs nyid kyi phyir a'adma ne'i tshig grub pa la nga rjes su 'brel pa byed pa ni ru tsa sogs kyi rgyu mtshan gyi a'adma ne'i tshigs kha gcig tu mi rtag pa'i don du'o //
translated: Because of ru-ca and so on of cakṣuḥ itself, the word an-na is formed, and the affix -ṅ is added to it. The reason for ru-ca and so on is that the word an-na is not one word, but has the meaning of impermanence.

original: de nas sa ha ste zhes sogs ma yin par grub bo //
analyzed: de nas sa ha ste zhes sogs ma yin par grub bo //

original: aa dza 'gro ba dang 'phen pa dag la'o zhes pa 'di byings thams cad pa ma yin pa'i yul la b'i ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro //🔽be t'a / be shya ti /🔽aa be shya ta /
analyzed: aa dza 'gro ba dang 'phen pa dag la'o zhes pa 'di byings thams cad pa ma yin pa'i yul la b'i ru bsgyur bar 'gyur ro // be t'a / be shya ti / aa be shya ta /
translated: The rule a-ja-to-going and throwing is not universal, but applies to the case of a root ending in a consonant.

original: byings thams cad pa min pa zhes pa ci zhe na /🔽aa dza ti /
analyzed: byings thams cad pa min pa zhes pa ci zhe na / aa dza ti /
translated: What is meant by not universal?🔽The rule a-ja-to-going and throwing is not universal, but applies to the case of a root ending in a consonant.

original: gang gi tshe 'dir bdun pa pha rol du gyur pa de'i tshe ni gsal byed kyi mtha' nyid las aa dzi las ghyan pha rol la b'i ru bsgyur ba la /🔽bee yam\/ zhes par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dir bdun pa pha rol du gyur pa de'i tshe ni gsal byed kyi mtha' nyid las aa dzi las ghyan pha rol la b'i ru bsgyur ba la / bee yam\/ zhes par 'gyur /
translated: When the seventh case is used here, then from the final consonant alone, by a-ja-to-going and throwing, the seventh case is changed to ba-ru, and becomes be-ta-.🔽The rule a-ja-to-going and throwing is not universal, but applies to the case of a root ending in a consonant.🔽When the seventh case is used here, then from the final consonant alone, by a-ja-to-going and throwing, the seventh case is changed to ba-ru, and becomes be-ta-.

original: bdun pa'i yul la bsgyur ba byas pa na dbyangs mtha' nyid las ya'i rkyen gyur pa be yam\ zhes pas grub bo //
analyzed: bdun pa'i yul la bsgyur ba byas pa na dbyangs mtha' nyid las ya'i rkyen gyur pa be yam\ zhes pas grub bo //
translated: The rule a-ja-to-going and throwing is not universal, but applies to the case of a root ending in a consonant.🔽When the seventh case is used here, then from the final consonant alone, by a-ja-to-going and throwing, the seventh case is changed to ba-ru, and becomes be-ta-.

original: ghanya dang aal dang kya pa la mi 'dod de /🔽sa m'a dza:/ sa ma dza:/🔽sa ma dzya:/ aa dzi'i sngon du sa ma'o //
analyzed: ghanya dang aal dang kya pa la mi 'dod de / sa m'a dza:/ sa ma dza:/ sa ma dzya:/ aa dzi'i sngon du sa ma'o //
translated: The rule a-ja-to-going and throwing is not universal, but applies to the case of a root ending in a consonant.🔽When the seventh case is used here, then from the final consonant alone, by a-ja-to-going and throwing, the seventh case is changed to ba-ru, and becomes be-ta-.🔽The rule a-ja-to-going and throwing is not universal, but applies to the case of a root ending in a consonant.

original: dngos po la ghanya dang bshad pa las aal dang sa ma dza a'a sa ni shat ces pas kya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po la ghanya dang bshad pa las aal dang sa ma dza a'a sa ni shat ces pas kya ba'o //
translated: When the seventh case is used here, then from the final consonant alone, by a-ja-to-going and throwing, the seventh case is changed to ba-ru, and becomes be-ta-.

original: n'a mi yang dag par gzung na rkyen gyi yon tan med par bshad pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur @216b gyi rnam pa gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: n'a mi yang dag par gzung na rkyen gyi yon tan med par bshad pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur @216b gyi rnam pa gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If nāma is taken correctly, it would be as explained, without the quality of the condition, and would not be otherwise.

original: cig shos ltar na /
analyzed: cig shos ltar na /

original: dza dza n'a ni /
analyzed: dza dza n'a ni /

analyzed: dza ghnu: zhes pa 'dir yang thab pa ma yin no //
translated: If it were so, then here also, in jagan, the u would not be elided, because of the condition of an, because of the quality.

original: de lta na 'o na phyi ma'i don du n'a mi gzung ba ste ait med pa'i san yon tan med pa dang bcas pa nyid las na mi'i ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na phyi ma'i don du n'a mi gzung ba ste ait med pa'i san yon tan med pa dang bcas pa nyid las na mi'i ji lta ba bzhin du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If that is so, then the na of anā is not taken for the sake of the future, because of the absence of ita, and because of the presence of the quality, it would be as if there were a na.

original: gzhan du na /
analyzed: gzhan du na /

original: 'o na yon tan bkag pa na yon tan can nyid don dang bcas pa'o zhes pas yon tan bzung bas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na yon tan bkag pa na yon tan can nyid don dang bcas pa'o zhes pas yon tan bzung bas ci bya zhe na /
translated: If the quality is negated, then because of the sense of the possessor of the quality itself, what is the use of taking the quality?

original: smras pa aa bhyasta rnams kyi aus\ la'o zhes pa 'di'i yang yon tan 'gag pa'i don yon tan bzung ba'o //
analyzed: smras pa aa bhyasta rnams kyi aus\ la'o zhes pa 'di'i yang yon tan 'gag pa'i don yon tan bzung ba'o //

original: rnam pa gzhan du na ji lta ba nyid du gnyis nyid dang mang po nyid dag gi 'ang ngo zhes pa 'di bkag pa la gnod pa nyid kyi yon tan aa bhy'asta rnams kyi aus ma 'jug pa de lta nyid du /

analyzed: aabhy'asta'i 'ang au ba dh'a'i zhes 'di la'ang bkag pa'i yon tan la gnod pa nyid do /
